Executive producer Cecile Frot-Coutaz says Idol isn't making the mistake of trying to replace Simon Cowell with a facsimile. You can't, and it would be foolish to try to do that, she says. "If you go, "We're going to find another slightly nasty British( recording) executive," people would reject that because that person would never live up to what Simon Cowell is.

explanation that the management reshuffle is about clarifying and tightening lines of authority among the troika that has jointly run Google for a decade. "This has nothing to do with competitors," Eric Schmidt said. I publicly said the next 10 years will be as successful as the past 10. We're going to run this way for a while. It's a full-time job just to deal with the areas Eric Schmidt will oversee, he said. ." International summits such as the World Economic Forum are clearly ripe for language interpretation, so could we soon be listening to digitised translations by Google? Eric Schmidt admits the software isn't that good. If it's really important- if it's heads of state negotiating missile defence- you're going to want to have two translators, both of them human, he says. While it's "far too early" for the congresswoman to speak, Kirsten Gillibrand said, she's using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and understand and show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing. Gabrielle Giffords began breathing without a ventilator yesterday as doctors took out the breathing tube that had run down her throat and replaced it with a tracheotomy tube in her windpipe. Surgeons also inserted a feeding tube.
